Legacy HNAP Service

NOTICE:

The namespace prefix http://cisco.com/jnap/ has been deprecated but is still supported. All JNAP clients should switch to the new namespace prefix http://linksys.com/jnap/.

Actions

ActivateTMSSS

http://linksys.com/HNAPExt/HND/ActivateTMSSS
DEPRECATED: This action will always return an 'OK' result with TAVSN set to an empty string.

Input Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
Locale LocaleCode no

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
TAVSN string no

Result

http://linksys.com/HNAPExt/HND/ActivateTMSSSResult
Value Description
OK Success.
ERROR Failure.

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: text/xml; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
SOAPAction: "http://linksys.com/HNAPExt/HND/ActivateTMSSS"

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<Envelope xmlns="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
  <Body>
    <ActivateTMSSS xmlns="http://linksys.com/HNAPExt/HND/">
      <Locale>en_US</Locale>
    </ActivateTMSSS>
  </Body>
</Envelope>
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: text/xml; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<Envelope xmlns="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
  <Body>
    <ActivateTMSSSResponse xmlns="http://linksys.com/HNAPExt/HND/">
      <ActivateTMSSSResult>OK</ActivateTMSSSResult>
      <TAVSN>example string</TAVSN>
    </ActivateTMSSSResponse>
  </Body>
</Envelope>

</Envelope>

          <AppliedDeviceList>
            <Device>
              <MacAddress>00:22:5F:A1:73:C1</MacAddress>
              <IPAddress>192.168.1.101</IPAddress>
              <IPStart>192.168.1.101</IPStart>
              <IPEnd>192.168.1.101</IPEnd>
            </Device>
          </AppliedDeviceList>
          <AccessSchedule>
            <Sunday>example string</Sunday>
            <Monday>example string</Monday>
            <Tuesday>example string</Tuesday>
            <Wednesday>example string</Wednesday>
            <Thursday>example string</Thursday>
            <Friday>example string</Friday>
            <Saturday>example string</Saturday>

          <BlockedURL>

          </BlockedKeyword>

GetTMSSSSettings

http://linksys.com/HNAPExt/HND/GetTMSSSSettings
DEPRECATED: This action will always return an 'OK' result with WTPEnabled set to false, WTPThreshold set to 0, and PCEnabled set to false.

Input Parameters

This action does not have any input parameters.

Output Parameters

Name Type Optional Description
WTPEnabled bool no
WTPThreshold int no
PCEnabled bool no

Result

http://linksys.com/HNAPExt/HND/GetTMSSSSettingsResult
Value Description
OK Success.
ERROR Failure.

Sample Transaction

POST [request-uri] HTTP/1.1
Host: 192.168.1.1
Content-Type: text/xml; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in request body]
SOAPAction: "http://linksys.com/HNAPExt/HND/GetTMSSSSettings"

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<Envelope xmlns="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
  <Body>
    <GetTMSSSSettings xmlns="http://linksys.com/HNAPExt/HND/">
    </GetTMSSSSettings>
  </Body>
</Envelope>
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Content-Type: text/xml; charset=utf-8
Content-Length: [number of octets in response body]

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<Envelope xmlns="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
  <Body>
    <GetTMSSSSettingsResponse xmlns="http://linksys.com/HNAPExt/HND/">
      <GetTMSSSSettingsResult>OK</GetTMSSSSettingsResult>
      <WTPEnabled>true</WTPEnabled>
      <WTPThreshold>123</WTPThreshold>
      <PCEnabled>true</PCEnabled>
    </GetTMSSSSettingsResponse>
  </Body>
</Envelope>

          </AppliedDeviceList>
